intro: Chiritopsis danxiaensis, commonly known as the Danxia dandelion, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically found in the Danxia landform regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow, resembling those of the common dandelion. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization.
